choices: Tell Jesse what happened and hope he understands
Dive under the water and swim away
111.content:
The view of the pumpkiny orange moon hanging low and plump over the ocean was almost hypnotizing and Celeste never had been able to ignore the sound of the waves lapping hungrily at the sugar sand.

With a silky laugh she raced ahead of Jesse down the beach,kicking off her sandals as she ran,then she yanked off her shirt and shimmied out of her tight short shorts..not an easy task when in motion,leaving her clothing where they fell,finally her tiny scraps of lace bra and panties joined the discarded items on the soft white sand mere seconds before arms circled her from behind and she felt her feet leave the ground.

"Put me down Jesse...No..don't you dare!"She yelped between giggles as her captor carried her into the surf in his strong arms,his chest warm and solid at her back and his hands cupping her lower cheeks.

She twisted her head to peer up into his sparkling silver eyes and a screech left her throat when a huge wave crashed over them,toppling them into the warmth of the oceans caressing depths.

Celeste came up spewing water from her mouth and the gleam of moonlight illuminating her water slickened hair and she turned in a circle,searching for Jesse.

At first the tingling that had settled in her long legs didn't bother her,she figured it was just the shock of the sand swirling around them,but soon the tingling had become a warm throbbing that made her frown slightly as she tread water,still looking for her errant boyfriend,then she scowled deeply because it felt like her legs had suddenly melded together and she twisted,trying to bring one of them up into view.

"Holy ----"The word trailed off as her legs came up out of the water and she blinked rapidly,surely she was seeing things for her legs looked to be covered in shimmering pinkish yellow scales now and her feet no longer existed,instead a finned tail graced the end of her limbs,which were definately more one now than two.

"Celeste!"Jesse's frantic voice snapped her out of her dream state and she let her legs.tail,whatever..submerge back into the water as she turned to watch him strike out toward her with sure strokes of his arms.

"Please,Jesse..I'm okay.."She babbled in a voice that she hoped sounded less shaky than what it sounded to her."I just...I want to swim for a while."

"Come on baby,This isn't funny."He scolded sharply when she began to ease herself backwards away from him so he couldn't touch her."We have to go,Everyones going to leave us."

"I'll catch a cab home."She breathed but his scowl had her treading water again."I love you but I want to be alone for a while,Please..."

She needed to think and she couldn't do that with him watching her like she'd grown a second head.
111.title: Celeste..a fish tail

choices: A merman rushes up to her and addresses her as queen!

Celeste explores and finds an interesting shipwreck...
1112.content:
"Celeste-!" Jesse extended his hand farther but the surf was pulling her further back into the ocean. "At least come to the house for ten more minutes. Then you can do whatever you want."

"You don't understand-" Celeste's hair started to creep along her back, independent of water or wind pushing it; it stretched from her skull, became more slippery and like seaweed in texture. The scales on her tail seemed to be spreading higher up her body past her stomach, thankfully submerged, and threatening to peek at her breasts where Jesse might see and comprehend the horrid change.

There was no time. "I'm sorry," she repeated and dove into the ocean, arms outstretched to propel herself out of earshot so she couldn't hear Jesse's pained cries. On the night when their love, hinted at for months, had finally surfaced with all its possibilities, now obtainable, fate had pulled Celeste away with a melodramatic flair. She swam deeper and deeper, neither the water pressure or lack of oxygen bothering her. The tail beat against the water viciously, leaving bubble trails as it cleared ten to fifteen feet at a time. She had only wanted Jesse as a boyfriend! She just wanted to finish college with him by her side, if they were lucky, but neither would be happening now, would it?

Celeste slowed down with a decisive flick of her tail, pulling it in front of her to break against the current until she was floating in one place. She looked for the shore but could only see cracked bedrock and beady-eyed fish gulping up krill. Scales now covered her body up to her breasts and where her skin persisted it gained a teal glow. Her hair was once a contained and manageable torrent, but underwater it exploded into multiple rapids flowing in many directions. It extended at least three feet away from her body and would, at rest, cover her rear. Strands floated in front of her eyes and glinted a mahogany red instead of their original blonde.

I'm alone... She thought. Alone and a mermaid... And I don't know whether to be surprised or just sad.
1112.title: Dive under the water and swim away

1122.content:
Your name is Elliot Dover, a young man from a long line of Irish fishermen. You have lived is the small town of Port Godfried, Oregon your entire life, spending your days combing the rocky beaches. You are the son of a fisherman and are learning to one day become one yourself. The ocean has always beckoned to you. Being a sailor is in your blood. But sailing had honestly never held your interest. Having been a lifeguard and a swimming intructor, you've always loved the water. But the waters of Port Godfried were known to be dangerous.

It was no secret that merfolk existed. They were highly intelligent and diverse in appearance. All are aquatic mammals. There are two types of merfolk known.
There are the peaceful Nyangumi, who migrate and follow the fish between the poles. Growing up to 30 feet long, they resemble both seals and orca whales in color and how they store blubber. They are very gentle and are the only semi-terrestrial merfolk. They used their strong upper bodies and thick claws to haul their bulk onto land to breed, bask, and raise their pups in ice dens.
The most dangerous type are the Bahari. Also called Sea Tigers, Baharis have sharp claws and lion-like teeth. Hunting in packs, Baharis are the wolves of the ocean. They are brightly colored for display and grow to be 20 feet long to deter other Bahari from attacking. They are aggressive and fiercely protective of their young. They live in the coastal and tropical waters of the world, and are as infamous as sharks.

Which kind are you?
1122.title: 20 years old (adult)

choices: Change you into a concious Bahari
Change you into a killer Bahari
11222.content:
Being a fisherman in Port Godfried had it's occupational hazards. Besides the obvious threat of a sudden storm or choppy seas, an everyday threat were the local gang of Baharis. This pack's territory was along the coastline of Port Godfried and loved to harass the fishermen. Your father's boat had a hansdome supply of moose darts to deter them if things became too hostile, and there was a harpoon waiting in case a Bahari decided to cause a real problem.

Today is a normal day. The sun is shining bright on a lovely fall afternoon. The air is still warm, but crisp. The leaves are bright oranges and yellows and the marina is buzzing with activity. But today, you are going out to sea alone. Against your father's wishes, of course, but you were confident. However, it was time for Baharis to have their pups. And that pack was not looking forward to any visitors.

As you pilot your little tugboat out to sea, you are oblivious to this fact. You pay little attention to the circling multicolotlred masses around your boat. You continue preparing your net to toss over to catch a nice load of cod. As you step near the edge, a female with her pups eyes you with bright magenta eyes. To her, you are a threat and she would not tolerate you. Just as you lean over to toss the net, the female bursts from the water and lands halfway on the boat, causing the whole thing to jolt and tilt. You cry out and jump back from the snarling beast. Her fangs are bared and her claws left long scratches in the steel flooring. In terror, you climb up the angled boat to the bow, spotting the harpoon. The female reaches a powerful arm out and tries to snatch you up, but her claws rake the floor instead. You dinally grab the harpoon and throw it right at the monster.

The harpoon pierced her right in the fleshy part of her neck. With a strangled cry, she released the boat, making it crash back to a level position. She struggled and thrashed, her powerful tail slamming into the stern and shoving the boat violently forwards. You watch as theBahari's struggles become weaker and weaker until she completely stopped. Moments later, five pups were circling her, chirping anxiously for their mother to wake. The other members of her pack watch. You had not only killed the mother of their pack's pups, you had killed their matriarch. They then set a curse upon you.

A curse that would...
11222.title: A monstrous Bahari

114.content:
Max had slept in his chambers for nearly a week, stricken with crippling seasickness. His family's expedition vessel had forayed forty miles off the coast of Bermuda and bumped into choppy waters mixed with torrential winds. Waves smashed into his window in time with the creaking floor and he swore a few drops managed to splash on him despite the "impenetrable steel skeleton" advertised by the ship makers; "skeleton" was an unfriendly word anyway, and it conjured in Max images of impending doom.

His parents spent most of their time trying to keep the ship on course, leaving him the only child to rot away below deck with his face green and throat trembling under the strain of rising vomit. He had regretted this vacation from the first day. In his more coherent moments he remembered his friend Sam back in Ann Arbor, playing Gears of War, hanging out with their other friends. Max didn't care if staying home meant going to school and facing the horrors of high school, freshman year; if it meant escaping this Godawful water ride he'd fly there.

On the last night of a two-day storm Max dreamed of standing on stage at an underwater opera house. Fish slouched their dorsal fins into the 1,000+ chairs and watched Max through binoculars they gripped in their mouths like fishing hooks. He sang a plangent, tremulous melody for them in a shrill soprano a 4'7'' body like his shouldn't be capable of. But his body wasn't the same, was it? He tried to look down while he sang against his will but his eyes forced themselves forward, and his arms motioned across the stage in time with his wordless crooning, and his toes tiptoed in place with balletic grace. Max thought it would be a relief to wake up and see his bone-white ceiling, made darker by shadows and his own nausea, with control over his limbs again. Instead he woke up to fog wrapped around him, obscuring an endless stretch of white caps crashing and foaming against sharp rocks.

Max awoke slouched on a rock instead of lying in bed, cradling a lyre under his left arm. He had drifted off in The Walking Dead boxers and a ratty t-shirt, but currently, the wind beat against a nude body reshaped by a more feminine touch. Looking down he saw it all: thicker, baby-fat thighs and feet speckled with silver fish scales; further up a crotch with hair and little else; further up a pleasant potbelly as soft to touch as, reaching back, his plumper butt; even further up breasts like he imagined under Natalia Hayworth's shirt in P.E; and right before his eyes a cascade of hazelnut hair combed perfectly to his right, bound in place by a clam-shell hairband.

At least, he was no longer nauseous.

I'm a girl? he tried to say, but instead his vocal chords resonated with an airy singing too beautiful for words. Max touched his throat, shocked. A few days ago in a sick daze he'd picked up a book on nautical mythology, and inside he'd seen a picture of a Siren. It had looked much like he did now. Was he stranded on a strange island, far from his parents in a strange form, because he read a book?
114.title: Max the Unassuming Siren

1212.content:
Maybe no one believed in making wishes on falling stars but she believed in alot of things no one else did..her dad kept telling her that that was her major problem,that she lived in a fantasy world..but what was wrong with that?

Taking a deep breath Kara Hunter leaned back and watched the streaking star arch across the sky,her long deep auburn hair brushing the grass behind her.

"I wish..Oh,I wish I could become graceful..powerful..beautiful..like this.."She breathed,her fingers tracing the lines of the dragon figurine her father had given her for her last birthday and tears stung at her almost closed emerald eyes.

She missed him so very much and without him her life wasn't worth very much at all,why not become the one thing that they had both loved when he still lived?

"Time to come inside!"The voice that startled her from her thoughts belonged to her Aunt Lindy and she heaved a sigh as she stood up,brushing the dead grass from her rump with her empty hand before she ambled toward the house she was supposed to call home now.

That night she dreamed of soaring through the skies on strong leathery wings,a graceful firey red dragon in all its glory,golden eyes staring down at a world she'd never seen...colors so very brilliant and the people who ran from her looked so small,so insignificant that when she woke a smile still curved her mouth..a smile that faded when she looked down at her hand that clutched her blanket to see crimson scales covering skin that had once been pale and almost flawless.

Biting back a scream Kara shook her hand and looked at it again to find that her skin was still pale and flawless..all too normal.

What the hell was going on?

"They had to be on drugs..imagining something like that."Aunt Lindy was talking into the phone when she went into the kitchen to grab a bowl of Cocoa Puffs for breakfast."I mean really Marge,Dragons aren't real."She rolled her eyes when Kara shot her a startled glance."I don't care that they said they got it on video,It couldn't be a dragon..maybe it was a new kind of bird and they were whacked out on acid or something."
1212.title: Kara,wishing upon a star

choices: Wait for her to cool down a bit before delivering your argument?
12121.content:
Kara had the words of her dream on her tongue, and an argument against the glorious dragon being nothing but a myth. But, she caught herself when she was about to deliver it. There's simply no way someone like her Aunt would even listen to Kara's argument.

"Dragons are a myth, a story built for someone's amusement, You got that!" By the looks of it, Aunt Lindy was starting to get worked up, as her breathing became deeper, and Kara could even see her face reddening a bit. "Dragons do NOT exist, you got that, I'm surprised you believe in this hoax." Lindy then hung up, breathing heavily.
12121.title: Tell someone about the dream

1213111.content:
Toby was on a run, easily keeping pace, with his best friend and roommate Daniel. It was early in the morning still, and the sun had just begun to rise over the snow tipped mountains surrounding the small town. Toby could see his breathe, and silently cursed his friend's name for making him get up so early. But, he continued on the run with his friend beside him.

The two were seniors at the college in town, with graduation just months away. They had just a few units this semester and managed to take their last classes together. One of those classes being in the morning, and why, according to Daniel at least, they needed to run early in the morning. "You know I don't like to run in the afternoon." Toby heard Daniel's voice in his head as the conversation from last night played in his mind. "The trails are too crowded. Besides... running in the morning makes you feel refreshed and energized the rest of the day." Daniel's last statement. The one that convince him to run with Daniel this morning.

Toby was so distracted that he missed the root. Suddenly, he found himself falling, face first into the dirt trail. An unbecoming yelp of surprise escaped Toby's mouth just before he caught himself with his hands planted in the dirt. Or mud actually. This part of the trail was still damp. Toby's ego was bruised when Daniel, of course, had to stop and laugh. Daniel did offer his hand to help his friend up a moment later.

"Okay, I think... that is enough running... for today." Toby said though breathes of air. "Let's start back..." He was rubbing his hands together, trying to wipe off the mud caked on them.

"Already... I guess we've been... out here awhile." Daniel said looking up at the early morning sky, between the leaves and branches having over the trail.

Toby turned to face the direction they had just come when he caught a glimpse of something in the corner of his eye. "What's that?" Toby was already heading over to the root that had tripped him. Under the some of the brush beside the root, there was a gold pointy corner sticking out. Toby wiped most of the mud onto his pants before bending down to pick up whatever had caught his attention. Pushing away the leaves, the gold corner was part of a book, a heavy. Toby picked off some of the leaves sticking to the book as he lifted it. "Wow, this is worth the fall."

The book felt like leather and seemed to be embroidered with what Toby assumed was gold and some gems. It had the emblem of a dragon in front. Daniel walked over and stood beside his friend to get a better look. "Nice find! It must be worth a lot!"

Toby opened it to a random page. At first glance, it seemed unreadable. It was written by hand, with some ornate drawings along with sides of the pages. The language was not English, but Toby could still piece out some words, like he knew the language. The one used most often was... 'Dragon.'

Daniel did not understand a single word of it, but the pictures on the page interested him. "This is neat. Whoever drew these had some talent. It looks like the guy in the picture was... transforming or something... a dragon"

"Into a dragon." Toby said, agreeing with his friend's assessment. The words, although hard to fully comprehend, supported that thought. "It's weird. I can read some of this."

"You can?" Daniel had a skeptical look on his face. "It looks like Greek to me."

"This page sounds like it is finishing a long explanation about dragons and... I guess dragon culture. Weird." He traced the lines of the page with a finger. "And here..." Toby pointed to a pointed to the paragraph. "It's talking about... transformation... a spell or something." He turned a couple pages, and skipped more towards the end of the book. "Look here. It is a phrase all by itself. Maybe this is the spell it was referring to earlier."

"Or spells." Daniel said, pointing to a couple other phrases that were separate and by themselves. "You found an Witch's book! Some crazy person's spell book." he teased.

"Ha ha..." Toby rolled his eyes. But, Daniel did have a point... though the book looked kind of old. At best, maybe it was worth a little money. Though... something about it called to him. Toby looked closely at several of the standalone phrases. He tried his hand at pronouncing the words in his head, and the more he went over them, the more he seemed to be able to say them. "Well, this one is interesting." He began reading it aloud, his tounge and mouth creating the words as if he really knew the language. A moment later, a great pain erupted through both of the college students.

1331.content:
"Back to work after your second year medical physical, they are a pain but working in the ring things infectious tend to fly about, I know, and having swallowed many a tossed turd!" Lionel said, he talking with Freddy, a recent novice added to the Rodeo clown staff.

"Yea, they poke and prod, injecting me with booster shots, seven of them, until I feel like a pin-cushion!" Fred replied, as he stood rubbing his upper arms with each a hand.

"Seven, they gave me six, as six is the normal number of infectious inoculations given each year, I wonder what extra shot they gave you?" Lionel asked, he looking rather concerned, as wondering if his new clown had something more to be concerned about.

"Freddy the clown," the audio speakers rang forth, asked for Fred to report to the rodeo office and do it urgent.

15322.content:
Your insomnia ensures that you're up before the Sun. That combined with your dislike for sleeping in tents. The archaeological dig site looks almost mystical with a low hazy mist covering the first open pits. As the lead archaeologist, you take this as a chance to inspect the progress the team has made.

Your current position feels more administrative, rather than practical. A quick, guilty inspection confirms there's no dirt ingrained beneath your fingernails, the outline of the ancient Roman temple clear through the remains of the walls. However, you don't know the actual state of things, instead your spreadsheet tells you exactly how the finances stand, how long you have left, and how much money you have.

The dew glistens, transferring to your hiking boots as you walk around the site. The hints of fragments visible on the surface confirm the period of the site. Your smile beams, as you find a mosaic floor with only a few cracks spoiling it's perfection. A soft grunt of surprise slipping out, it's almost too perfect. Normally, you'd expect the walls to be re-used over time, stolen to build homes and other buildings over the centuries between then and now.

Perhaps there were more worshippers here, or the locals were more kindly treated by the Romans here. Either respect or fear, you decide. One or the other would be good reasons for the good condition of the site. Thinking over the papers you'll be able to write about this, you smile to yourself, inhaling the streaming coffee vapour curling up from your tin cup.

It's then that you take a second more intense look at the mosaic. It looks as if one of the figures is pointing oddly. A Roman noblewoman, whose attention is in the opposite direction from everyone else in the design. Following her outstretched hand, you find the edge of the pattern. The tessellation just a little thicker than elsewhere. Plucking your brush from your tool belt, you kneel down and go to work. A guilty thrill as you clear away the dirt from area. An irregular outline is revealed, briefly you consider calling Jack,or waking one of the rest of the team to share.

But the orange Sun streams through the branches of the nearby copse, reminding you how early it is. Dismissing it as nerves, you see your fingers are now dirty, and you do now have dirt beneath your fingernails. Carefully with your trowel, you lever the section of mosaic up and away. You've found it, a hidden compartment. Giddy as a child with his first taste of wine, you see a stone flask inside. The seal on the hidden chamber so good, that the flask is pristine, it simply lies there unsullied by dirt, even the stopper: a stone marble held in place with a red wax seal.

Cautiously, you pick it up, turning it over and over admiring the glazing, and the design. It looks out of place, the figures dancing round and around. The tallest one, obviously intended as a God. But, it's none of the pantheon of Roman Gods. A soft moan slipping out, as you realise that's why it's hidden. It's heretical, a throw back to some other worship. Turning it one last time you see the final face of the 'dance', the figures entwined in passion.

Nodding at your own speculation, this is dedicated to a more hedonistic God, to a more pleasure oriented life, one dedicated to Pan... or Bacchus. Or maybe one of the tricksters, amusing themselves by tormenting mortals.

Despite your caution and gentleness, the wax seal crumbles at your touch, and the marble stopper falls with a crack to the mosaic. A thin tendril of green smoke snakes out of the flask.

Corrosion?, Copper?, desiccated wine?

It's not scientific, but you lean closer and take an sniff. As if responding to an invitation, as if triggering a conscious reaction, the green vapour moves with unnatural speed towards your nostrils. Blinking rapidly, your eyes are filled with hypnotic visions of wanton, lusty behaviour. Oddly, unsettlingly, arousingly, you see yourself from the female perspective, her passion mounting, her body alert and pleasure filled. You don't notice as your body slips backwards, you sprawl across the mosaic your body twitching, as your skin ripples and transforms.

An unfamiliar voice haunts you, mocks you. "Time to leave those dull books behind you, and restore your passion for life, your passion for adventure and excitement."

The sentiment chimes with your own thoughts, about leaving the administrative side of things, returning to getting your hands dirty.

"Oh, you'll be dirty." the voice confirmed with amusement.

"Dirty girl..."

Snapping upright, as if waking from a dream, or surfacing from a deep dive. You awake with a heaving gasp. Looking around you see the walls of hotel room, one you wish you could have used for the dig. But financial restraint meant that staying in tents bought you another day of digging. However, you barely noticed the room, barely questioned your presence there. A more immediate, more pressing problem demanded answers.

https://68.media.tumblr.com/0698fd233880...

Your body, your voluptuous Succubus-sweet body. Your hands roamed over your new curves, every caressing touch confirming it was too real to be a dream, to sensitive to be imagined.

"My first convert." that teasing male voice making you feel vulnerable and naked. You know it's inside your head, even as your eyes dart around for an intruder, a face at the window....

To your surprise she placed your head atop her neck. Your eyes fluttered open. Your long brown hair laid across her bare shoulders, and your bright blue eyes stared at you. You try to talk, but find yourself unable to. The dullahan who now bears your head...
15533222221221.title: needs a new head

155332222212212.content: The head thief turns around and walks away without a word. Still in slight shock from having your head stolen you stand for a few moments thinking. You decide to...
155332222212212.title: Just leaves

1553322222122121.content: The shock of your beheading passes in an instant. You think to yourself,(despite not having a head) that you must reacquire your head from this thief. After all one cannot function in normal society without one. You ''look'' around, noticing the dullahan and your head are both gone. You think to yourself, how did she get so far so quickly? You then remember that you were beheaded and still live, so maybe it isn't best to ask questions like this. You however do notice, some depressions in the soil. Thinking to yourself that these might be the dullahan's footprints and therefore the best point to start your journey from, you begin to follow the footprints.
1553322222122121.title: Go get your head back

1553322222122122.content:
You figure you can make it without a head. Plus, what would the dullahan do? She had a sword, you didn't, she could just keep taking more.
Deciding your best and safest route was to remain headless, you headed...
1553322222122122.title: Leave it as is

15533222221221222.content:
You walk back into town, aware that people might be surprised to see someone walking without a head and not react well. You don't exactly have a choice, you don't want to get into more trouble finding your head back, and it's probably east to adjust to life without a head.

Once you set foot in town, the people...
15533222221221222.title: into town

155332222212212222.content: Even without a head, you felt an odd feeling that something is not right. This mood does not feel like how it usually is and all of this is from our gut and skin. As it turns out...
155332222212212222.title: Are a bit... different

choices: Interact with some of the people
1553322222122122222.content:
Good news: You're not alone in your state.
Bad news: As you could have guessed, everyone in town has no head.

The place has become much quieter but damn, seeing all these headless people is so disconcerting, you might want to take a breather, however that will work.
1553322222122122222.title: Everyone has their heads stolen

info.brief_description: One day, you get turned into a creature of myth.
info.description:
You were living a normal life (modern), until one day, you get turned into some mythical creature. anything goes except for these exceptions:

transformations in this interactive should be gradual, unless the main character is waking up to it or is unaware (entranced or distracted deeply). It should take a minimum of one paragraph

no dead ends, at least one way continues at all times and no sudden death, like the main character randomly gets hit by a meteor and dies

At leave some breaks that other stuff happens inbetween the sex seens, even if the creature chosen focuses on sex (i.e. succobus/incobus)

Magic or other supernatural forces Is allowed and actually encouraged.

Stay in character

Other people can change and the main character can meet characters from other storylines


Other than that, pretty much everything goes!
